abstract: More photos of the East Village steakhouse, reviewed by Julia Moskin, that offers Korean barbecue made with USDA prime meat.
snippet: More photos of the East Village steakhouse, reviewed by Julia Moskin, that offers Korean barbecue made with USDA prime meat.
lead_paragraph: Prime & Beyond serves great steaks, but it also offers a rare opportunity to taste what Korean barbecue is like when made with USDA prime meat. Bulgogi (thin-sliced steak) and kalbi (short ribs) have a rich, succulent depth that you don't often taste at the DIY BBQ joints on 32nd Street. And the burger, although plain - not a "bulgogi burger" marinated with garlic, sesame, and sugar - is fantastic, served Korean-style, with rice, kimchi, and a softly fried egg to bind all together.
